thread.title: Top travel photos of the week
thread.title_full: Top travel photos of the week

title: Top travel photos of the week
persons: LASZLO BALOGH/Reuters LASZLO BALOGH/Reuters LASZLO BALOGH/Reuters LASZLO
text:
Top travel photos of the week Last updated 05:00, August 14 2015 REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Dan Kitwood/Getty Images Dan Kitwood/Getty Images LASZLO BALOGH/Reuters LASZLO BALOGH/Reuters LASZLO BALOGH/Reuters LASZLO BALOGH/Reuters EDDIE KEOGH/Reuters GORAN TOMASEVIC/Reuters MIKE BLAKE/Reuters FRANCOIS LENOIR/Reuters David Ramos/Getty Images David Ramos/Getty Images PASCAL ROSSIGNOL/France MARCELO DEL POZO/Reuters MOHAMED ABD EL GHANY/Reuters GORAN TOMASEVIC/Reuters REUTERS/Darren Staples/Files REUTERS/Sergio Perez GORAN TOMASEVIC/Reuters YANNIS BEHRAKIS/Reuters Getty Images HEINZ-PETER BADER/Reuters FRANCOIS LENOIR/Reuters REUTERS/Chaiwat Subprasom REUTERS/Alexandre Meneghini FRANCOIS LENOIR/Reuters REUTERS/Vasily Fedosenko ARND WIEGMANN/Reuters REUTERS/Ilya Naymushin Matt Cardy/Getty Images Suhaimi Abdullah/Getty Images Lisa Maree Williams/Getty Images Mark Metcalfe/Getty Images 
The hands of a man is pictured as he works to make an effigy of the demon Ghantakarna, before it is burnt to symbolise the destruction of evil, during the Ghantakarna festival at the ancient city of Bhaktapur, Nepal. According to local folklore, the demon Ghantakarna is believed to "steal" children and women from their homes and localities. 
Men smell ales at the CAMRA (campaign for real ale) Great British Beer festival at Olympia London exhibition centre in London, England. 
The five day event is Britain's largest beer festival with around 55,000 people expected to attend. The festival features over 900 British real ales, ciders and perries from around the world on sale. 
Revellers play with foam during the Sziget music festival on an island in the Danube River in Budapest. 
Revellers cool themselves in the Danube River during the Sziget music festival on an island in Budapest, Hungary. 
A heatwave has hit Hungary with temperatures topping 38 degrees Celsius. 
A view of the Danube River during the Sziget music festival on an island in Budapest, Hungary. 
A meteor streaks across the sky during the Perseid meteor shower near Wendover, southern England. 
An elephant walks through a swamp in Amboseli National park, Kenya. 
The city of Los Angeles, California is pictured on a hot summer day. 
A dining table is decorated with flowers at the Flowertime event in Brussels' town hall, Belgium. 
Festival goers enjoy the atmosphere at the official meeting point in La Mar Bella beach during the Circuit Festival in Barcelona, Spain. The Circuit Festival is considered the Europe's biggest gay and lesbian festival. More than 70,000 people flock to Barcelona every August to enjoy 12 days of parties and activities around the city. 
Festival goers are expected to spend about 150 million euros during the Festival. The Festival was born in Barcelona in 2008 by the Matinee Group and nowadays they are organizing similar festival in more than 20 countries such as Dubai, Russia and Israel. 
French police on roller blades patrol along the banks of the Seine during the Paris plage event in Paris, France,. 
Jockeys ride during a traditional race along the beach of Sanlucar de Barrameda, southern Spain. 
A boy plays with his dog along the beach at the river Nile, to escape from the hot weather, on the outskirts of Cairo, Egypt. 
Zebras tussle in Amboseli National park, Kenya. 
Members of the public queue to view the coffin of King Richard III at Leicester Cathedral, central England. Little could Shakespeare, who wrote in Tudor times, have known that Richard would become a posthumous global celebrity and Britain's latest phenomenon in royal tourism. Remains suspected to be those of the last king of the Plantagenet dynasty were discovered in 2012 in an unmarked grave beneath a car park in the east midlands city of Leicester. In March his remains were reburied in an elegant limestone-and-marble tomb in Leicester Cathedral in a major public ceremony. The cathedral, which prior to Richard's entombment would get a handful of visitors daily, had almost 2000 people visit one day last spring, church officials said. 
Tourists take a selfie in front of Madrid's famous landmark Puerta de Alcala. Spain hosted record numbers of tourists in the first half of 2015, feeding an economic rebound as sun-seekers from Europe and the United States headed for its shores. Spain got 29.2 million foreign visitors in the six months to June, up 4.1 per cent from the same period a year ago, according to Frontur, an industry ministry body. 
An elephant walks out of a swamp in front of tourists in Amboseli National park, Kenya. 
Tourists lie on a beach as migrants and refugees from Syria and Africa arrive on a dinghy at the Greek island of Kos after crossing a part of the Aegean Sea between Turkey and Greece. 
A bulldozer collects money given by the tourists voluntarily after watching the performance at Song Dynasty Town in Hangzhou, Zhejiang Province of China. Tourists paid voluntarily at any price they liked after watching the performance which had an original cost of 300 RMB (about NZ$71) at Song Dynasty Town in Hangzhou. 
Tourists walk past a lawn-sprinkler in Volksgarten park on a sunny summer morning in Vienna. 
Tourists take photographs of a floral display at the Flowertime event on Brussels' Grand Place and town hall, Belgium. 
Tourists ride elephants in the ancient Thai capital Ayutthaya, north of Bangkok, Thailand. Thailand celebrates World Elephant Day on August 12, an annual event held to raise awareness about elephant conservation. 
Tourists travelling in a vintage car takes pictures of the US embassy in Havana, Cuba. 
A tourist uses a selfie stick to take a photograph near a floral display at the Flowertime event on Brussels' Grand Place, Belgium. The event has an Italian baroque theme this year. 
A meteor streaks across the sky over an Orthodox church during the Perseid meteor shower near the village of Malashki, north of Minsk, Belarus. The annual Perseid meteor shower reaches its peak on August 12 and 13 in Europe, according to NASA. 
Visitors walk through an artificially made ice cave in the Rhone glacier near the Furka mountain pass in the Swiss Alps 
Clouds are seen in the sky after sunset above the Yenisei River in Taiga district outside the Siberian city of Krasnoyarsk, Russia. 
Crowds watch as tethered balloons are illuminated by their burners during the night glow evening event on the first day of the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta at the Ashton Court estate in Bristol, England. Now in its 37th year, the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta is Europe's largest annual hot air balloon event in the city that is seen by many balloonists as the home of modern ballooning. 
People wave the 'Singapore' scarf during the National Day Parade at Padang in Singapore. 
Varia Bell poses during The SMASH - Sydney Manga and Anime Show at Rosehill Gardens in Sydney, Australia. 
An opera singer poses during Opera Australia's 2016 Season Media Launch and 60th birthday celebration at Sydney Opera House. 1 of 34 
Here is our round up of the top travel photos from around the world. 
Do you have a favourite? Let us know in the comments.
